urls.title: Five Winners of the second ever Earthshot Prize Awards unveiled - The Earthshot Prize
urls.description: The five winners of The Earthshot Prize Prize 2022 have been revealed at an impactful Awards Ceremony in Boston.

data.text:
5) Fix Our Climate - @4401earth

Eliminating millions of tonnes of CO2 cheaply & safely remains a challenge.

44.01 removes CO2 permanently & quickly by mineralising it in a rock called peridotite. Through its process, they make removing CO2 more cost-effective, scalable & safe.

4) Build a Waste-Free-World - @notpla 

Just 9% of all the plastic ever produced has been recycled and 12% has been incinerated.

Notpla is an alternative to plastic made from seaweed & plants.

Their farmed seaweed captures carbon 20x faster than trees.

3) Revive Our Oceans - @QldWomenRangers

The Great Barrier Reef is under constant threat. The region’s indigenous female rangers are vital to its defence.

The training they provide and data they collect gives us a critical insight into one of the most important ecosystems on 🌏

2) Clean Our Air - @MukuruStoves

Mukuru stoves burn cleaner, creating 90% less pollution than open fires & 70% less than traditional cookstoves. 

Costing just $10 & halving ongoing fuel costs, this innovative solution uses processed biomass made from charcoal, wood & sugarcane.

1) Protect & Restore Nature - Kheyti

Their Greenhouse-in-a-Box is designed for small-hold farmers (80% of world farms are small farms) and the crops they grow, offering protection from elements & pests.

Plants require 98% less water than those outdoors & yields are 7x higher!

Our Winners' solutions have so much depth and impact it's almost impossible to explain in just one tweet. 

But we’re going to give it a go.

[a thread]

@EarthshotPrize every single of of the finalist innovators are INCREDIBLE. I’m so glad they’ll all be supported. The winners are ones I LOVE LOVE LOVED from the 5 series outlining the finalist. I’m so filled with hope #EarthshotBoston2022 thank you for bringing excellence to 🇺🇸 @KensingtonRoyal

5) Fix Our Climate - @4401earth

Eliminating millions of tonnes of CO2 cheaply & safely remains a challenge.

44.01 removes CO2 permanently & quickly by mineralising it in a rock called peridotite. Through its process, they make removing CO2 more cost-effective, scalable & safe.

4) Build a Waste-Free-World - @notpla 

Just 9% of all the plastic ever produced has been recycled and 12% has been incinerated.

Notpla is an alternative to plastic made from seaweed & plants.

Their farmed seaweed captures carbon 20x faster than trees.

3) Revive Our Oceans - @QldWomenRangers

The Great Barrier Reef is under constant threat. The region’s indigenous female rangers are vital to its defence.

The training they provide and data they collect gives us a critical insight into one of the most important ecosystems on 🌏

2) Clean Our Air - @MukuruStoves

Mukuru stoves burn cleaner, creating 90% less pollution than open fires & 70% less than traditional cookstoves. 

Costing just $10 & halving ongoing fuel costs, this innovative solution uses processed biomass made from charcoal, wood & sugarcane.

1) Protect & Restore Nature - Kheyti

Their Greenhouse-in-a-Box is designed for small-hold farmers (80% of world farms are small farms) and the crops they grow, offering protection from elements & pests.

Plants require 98% less water than those outdoors & yields are 7x higher!

Our Winners' solutions have so much depth and impact it's almost impossible to explain in just one tweet. 

But we’re going to give it a go.
